name: mutability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to change or the fact of being likely to change: He is interested in the mutability of identity, the way people can slip in and out of personas to fit the occasion. The social institution is not fixed, but has a degree of mutability.
More examplesFewer examplesA new generation of managers has accepted the constant mutability of the Internet.Mutability is evident in all the forms of things in the river.Despite its apparent mutability, the bacterium does have the power to protect its genetic integrity.
